<a id="AudioEffectEQ"></a>

# AudioEffectEQ

**Inherits:** [AudioEffect](AudioEffect.md) **\<** [Resource](Resource.md) **\<** [RefCounted](RefCounted.md) **\<** [Object](Object.md)

**Inherited By:** [AudioEffectEQ10](AudioEffectEQ10.md), [AudioEffectEQ21](AudioEffectEQ21.md), [AudioEffectEQ6](AudioEffectEQ6.md)

Base class for audio equalizers. Gives you control over frequencies.

Use it to create a custom equalizer if [AudioEffectEQ6](AudioEffectEQ6.md), [AudioEffectEQ10](AudioEffectEQ10.md) or [AudioEffectEQ21](AudioEffectEQ21.md) don't fit your needs.

<!-- classref-introduction-group -->

## Description

AudioEffectEQ gives you control over frequencies. Use it to compensate for existing deficiencies in audio. AudioEffectEQs are useful on the Master bus to completely master a mix and give it more character. They are also useful when a game is run on a mobile device, to adjust the mix to that kind of speakers (it can be added but disabled when headphones are plugged).

<!-- classref-introduction-group -->

## Tutorials

- [Audio buses](../tutorials/audio/audio_buses.md)
